issue.title: Obtain tx hash and tx output index from amount and output offset
issue.body:
Fixes problem of obtaining incorrect outputs used for tx input.

Reverts to earlier intended behavior that was fixed in previous
commit's split of get_output_tx_and_index into two functions.

comment.body:
An earlier commit accidentally introduced a bug:

https://github.com/tewinget/bitmonero/commit/4ff2e767d3df1af8d535a7bb0f7fe2aba478e50e#diff-682e2df37e57ef9ef90c8def3523294eR1566
`k = MDB_val_copy<uint64_t>(glob_index);`
- k never gets set to the MDB conversion of glob_index
- so glob_index isn't the index being used in the subsequent mdb_get
- so that function fails

The failure caused by that assignment bug was attempted to be fixed in a later commit on this line, but it didn't fix the actual bug.
https://github.com/tewinget/bitmonero/commit/0554e76e0c277e5cf0588ab0f24c040f7e14bbfb#diff-1279d7b0ddc432573cd2bd8c6e632c1fL173

The assignment bug itself was inadvertently removed in another part of that same commit during a refactoring:
https://github.com/tewinget/bitmonero/commit/0554e76e0c277e5cf0588ab0f24c040f7e14bbfb#diff-682e2df37e57ef9ef90c8def3523294eL1252

But because that same commit changed the function call, the true problem wasn't fixed.

So the fix in this PR simply reverts to the original intended behavior.

issue.title: Apply inline
issue.body:
In preparation for the Spring 15 Call for Students, I've been working on improving our application flow in a branch called `apply-inline` and wanted to share my progress here. 

We shouldn't merge this until the call is ready to go out, but thought we could discuss what I changed, and what's left to do in this Pull Request thread. I think it's really close!

## Nav

- Top navigation now links to `Participate` which is information about the call, and `Apply` which is the actual form. Bootstrap has a cool little highlighted label where I put the date, but we could also do a countdown.

![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 8 08 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591426/d739785e-9128-11e4-9c03-d373322ce58f.png)

## Participate

1. Short "Open Calls" introduction with buttons for **Apply Now** (jumps to: Apply) or **Read More** (jumps down to full text of Call for Students)
2. Alumni testimonials sidebar, (editable via `/_data/testimonials.yml`) (fixes #61?)
3. "Scenes from School" slideshow (we should add more images)
4. Full text of Spring 2015 Call for Students

![participate school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591348/7cbc3be0-9124-11e4-8e4d-4e5692bcdf89.png)

## Apply

1. Migrating from Google Forms (off-site form, spreadsheet backend, free) to Formkeep (on-site form, very usable backend, pay what you wish).
  - With Google Forms we didn't have much control over how the application looked, and answers were stored in a hard to read spreadsheet.
  - Formkeep is simply an endpoint that accepts answers from a form on our site, displays the answers in a much more readable backend, and allows us to search applications and mark spam if necessary.
2. Application is editable via `/_data/application.json`, and is completely customizable.
3. Sidebar shows application/admissions timeline and helpful hints.

![apply school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591350/809b6d3a-9124-11e4-94a8-46257ddf3a36.png)

## Thanks

1. After a successful submit, thank the applicant and shower them with virtual confetti. (Looks really smooth in the browser, the GIF just has a low frame rate.)
2. Added prompts to share the Participate page on Facebook and Twitter

![thanks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591351/88f8d616-9124-11e4-926f-c1cb65eb7783.gif)

## (Optional) Share Prompts

- There are optional, and we can customize what they say/how they look by adding some metadata tags, if anyone has edits.

| Twitter | Facebook |
| --------- | ------------- |
| ![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 7 01 37 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591266/8b09f0f2-911f-11e4-8ead-75f9a25cffe0.png) | ![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 7 01 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591268/8e1f18c6-911f-11e4-8cf7-a574620c1451.png) |

## FAQ

- Has a new Table of Contents navigation, which sticks to the screen as you scroll and highlights the answer you're on.

![faq school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591352/8ed4deae-9124-11e4-9bcc-846c2eefaaec.png)

## Formkeep Backend

- This is what Formkeep looks like.

![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 6 58 21 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591257/4e894a38-911f-11e4-8cc9-95e66249a978.png)

- - -

## Missing Pieces

I'm excited about all this! Hope you are too.

Here's what's left to do:

- Add in new FAQ content, once finalized (via `/_faqs/section.md`)
- Final application questions (via `/_data/application.json`)
- Final application schedule  (via `/layouts/apply.html`)
- Any design/flow tweaks you might think of
- Internal testing (it worked for me, but would be great to kick the tires.)

comment.body:
also, I think we should do some font work to not have apercu all over the body pages, etc -- it feels like there's some font love needed, things like this seem a bit off to me: 

![screen shot 2015-01-01 at 10 31 46 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/142897/5592524/78f8044e-91a1-11e4-97e9-b7467438f25e.png) 

it's def. not crucial and can come later, just want to mention that finding a good body font and using it all 
throughout the body in different weights, sizes etc makes sense.  I kind of don't like apercu that much through the body, it looks good on the nav / logo to me.

issue.title: breaking change in atom-shell 0.20.3 build
issue.body:
The 'atom.gyp' rigging needs to be fixed for atom-shell 0.20.3 and beyond. The upstream build process has changed in order to make this customization simpler. Now the suggested method of renaming is:

```shell
export GYP_DEFINES="product_name=MyApp project_name=myapp"
./script/update.py
./script/build.py -C Release -t myapp
```

In grunt-build-atom-shell 1.1.4, attempting to compile atom-shell 0.20.3 will throw the following error:

```
>> Running: python script/bootstrap.py
>> Running: python script/build.py -c Release -t triple-triad-atom
>> ninja: error: unknown target 'triple-triad-atom'
```

The 'atom.gyp' file ends up containing:

```
    'project_name%': 'atom',
    'product_name%': 'Atom',
```

Dealing with quoting and interpolation for multiple options in a single string feels weird for me, so it might just be simpler to add another two replace statements for the new form. I haven't looked at the changes in depth to see what else might have changed (or if those defines are used in other places).

If I get un-lazy I'll patch and submit a pull quest, but considering i'm both lazy and hung over you'll probably get to it first. :laughing:

comment.body: @ttilley Good catch - I knew about the breaking changes but not about the typo. Can you submit a PR to fix the typo to Atom Shell, and I'll work on updating grunt-build-atom-shell to be compatible with both <  0.20.3 and >= 0.20.3

issue.title: ./jtrts.pl -internal -q fails for form=osc
issue.body:
"caused" by https://github.com/magnumripper/JohnTheRipper/commit/546a203d4b673a6f15e3e25186b674e80a44fa18 which repeated the test hash in the canonical format used for john.pot.
```
(master)test $ ./jtrts.pl -internal -q
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- JtR-TestSuite (jtrts). Version 1.13, Dec 21, 2014.  By, Jim Fougeron & others
- Testing:  John the Ripper password cracker, version 1.8.0.2-jumbo-1-bleeding_omp [linux-gnu 64-bit AVX2-autoconf]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
form=osc                          guesses:    1 -show=   1 0:00:00:00 DONE : Expected count(s) (2)(-show2)  [!!!FAILED!!!]
Some tests had Errors. Performed 295 tests.  1 errors00:00 DONE  [PASSED]
Time used was 75 seconds
```
I didn't revert this JtR addition:
```
+ // repeat hash in the same form that is used in john.pot
+ {"$dynamic_4$05de5c963ee6234dc7d52f7589a1922b$ ", "welcome"},
```
Because I think it is a TS problem. (`./john --test` doesn't fail)

comment.body:
```
$ ../run/john -ses=./tst  -skip -pot=./tst.pot selftest.in --wordlist=selftest.dic -form=osc
Loaded 2 password hashes with 2 different salts (osc, osCommerce [md5($s.$p) (OSC) 128/128 XOP 768x4x2])
Will run 4 OpenMP threads
Press 'q' or Ctrl-C to abort, almost any other key for status
welcome          (?)
1g 0:00:00:00 DONE (2015-01-01 09:32) 8.403g/s 16.80p/s 33.61c/s 33.61C/s welcome..welcome
Use the "--show" option to display all of the cracked passwords reliably
Session completed
At Program Exit
MemDbg_Validate level 0 checking Passed
```
This is not a problem in the TS. It is telling you the truth.  JtR (right now), could only crack 1 hash.  Also, it said 2 salts, but there 'should' only be 1.

I am not sure of the issue here. It may be due to trailing ' ' chars being stripped off INSIDE of john core.  Yes, I know you wanted to make this the same as it is within john.pot, BUT I do not think you can.  I think you will have to use $HEX$2020 simply due to how the code within JtR loader.c works.

issue.title: Hanukkah code review - main.js
issue.body:
**General**
- [x] Line 1: Put `"Handlebars": true` in your `.jshintrc` file, under `globals`
- [x] Variables declarations (add indentation):
```js
// Bad
var one = 13,
two = 20;

// Good
var one = 13,
    two = 20;

// Or - As seen in some libraries 
var
    one = 13,
    two = 20;
```
Read: <http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/229694/multiple-var-statements-in-javascript>
- [ ] `$('#quick-reports-panel')` and `$('#my-team-folders-panel')` are repeated several times in the code, better cache them in a variable.
  - [x] Also, you're getting an elm by ID, so `.eq(0)` is redundant.
  - [ ] Also, you can use `$('#quick-reports-panel, #my-team-folders-panel')` to get a jQuery object with both of these elements and put that into a variable, and then use `panels.each()` on that. See [.each](http://api.jquery.com/each/)
  - Note that when using `.each`, a `return` inside it will not halt the outer function.
- [ ] Add comments to blocks of code (inside the big functions)

**UTILS.isEnterOrSpace**
- [x] No need for `e.which`. `e.keyCode` is usually enough, unless you try to capture which Mouse button was clicked (and you're not).

**dataStorage.exportData:**
- [ ] See my 3rd point at the top. Then the `var`'s inside the `for` loop will not hoist to the top
- [ ] You must use `Modernizr` before using `localStorage` (the `if` will not help)
See <http://codepen.io/netcraft/pen/QwbPYb?editors=001>
- [ ] Better save the data under descriptive keys like `formHtml`, `index`, `val`, instead of an array
Then it'll be easier and more clear to fetch the data in `dataStorage.importData`.
This will change how you use the Handlebars Template, instead of `this` you'll have 

**dataStorage.importData:**
- [ ] Modernizr again, and you must use a `try catch` when doing `JSON.parse()`, see the link above.
- [ ] See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] Add comments to blocks of code

**dropdowns**
- [x] `init`: If you're calling methods of `dropdowns` with that keyword, you can ditch the `this` keyword idea and then you won't need the `call` in `dropdowns.openDropdown.call`.
- [x] `openDropdown`: Ditch the `this`
- [x] `init`: I prefer the `on` variation for event listeners, since it's more explicit, and easier to change to event delegation (optional).

**tabs**
- [x] `this` - Decide how you're using it and be consistent, either `tabs.` or `this.`. Personally, I think that `this` is useful only in Constructors, and here you can call it by name, as in an API.
- [ ] `init`: Ditch the `bind`, not needed since you're already calling it with `tabs` context.
- [x] `init` - Cache `e.target`, even if you were using it once.
- [ ] `init` - Narrow down the `keydown` handling from `document` to something more specific.
- [ ] `getPanel`: If you comment the function, use [JSDoc](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSDoc)
- [ ] `updateAria`: Chain methods using `.`. Also, you're using `removeAttr` and after that setting it, just set it and that's it.
- [ ] `activate`: Cache `$('.active-tab')`
- [ ] `hash`: Rename this function to something that describes what it does

**formsBehavior**
- [ ] Ditch the `.bind`, everywhere!
- [ ] `init`: See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] `escForm`: Use [event delegation](http://codepen.io/netcraft/pen/yyeoJw?editors=001)
- [ ] `escapePress`: Ditch the `e.which`
- [ ] `displayOrHideForm`: Rename to `toggle...`
- [ ] `isValidUrlRegex`: Use the work of others and add a link to the [source](https://mathiasbynens.be/demo/url-regex) (@diegoperini won)
- [ ] `setHttp`: If the URL passes the RE, do nothing, you must not lowercase it, since some URLs are case sensitive (only check if it doesn't pass it).
- [ ] `validateURL`: Rename to `sanitizeURL`, since it's not only validating the URL. See [this](http://drupal.stackexchange.com/questions/1967/what-does-sanitized-mean-in-api-documentation)
- [ ] `fillTabContent`: Use `$.each`
- [ ] `displayWebsites`: See my 3rd point at the top
- [ ] `validateForm`: `something !== ''` is the same as `something`

**searchBox**
- [ ] `init`: This is a form, you can use the `submit` event on it instead of `keydown`, since you only catch the `enter` anyway.

**initSite**
- [ ] What if the file doesn't exist? You should catch it with `.fail` and notify about it.

comment.body:
@alexilyaev 
When ditching 'bind' some functions don't work properly, because 'this' is another context.

issue.title: return URL is not preserved after login failure page reload
issue.body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Setup a site with guest and registered type of users with a standard login access on a menu item. Non-registered users should be given guest permissions.
Define a menu item that can only be accessed with registered user rights.
Try to access this menu item by providing the URL directly without being logged in.
Now the login form should appear.

Try to log in with an existing user **but wrong password**.
You should get an error message.
Now try to log in with the correct password.

#### Expected result
You are redirected to the target menu link.

#### Actual result
You are **not** redirected to the target menu link.

#### System information (as much as possible)
Joomla 2.5.19, basic setup with guest and registered users

#### Additional comments
The reason for this is that the return URL which is passed in the form as a hidden input parameter is not preserved after reloading the login page due to the login error.

comment.body:
I'm closing this issue since Joomla 2.5 is no longer supported and thus this will not be fixed anymore.
If the issue still exists in Joomla 3.x, please open a new issue for it.

issue.title: Blob object's data stream incomplete for certain files
issue.body:
```python
>>> import git
>>> git.__version__
'0.3.2.1'
>>> import os
>>> os.mkdir('foo')
>>> repo = git.Repo.init('foo')
>>> repo.create_remote('origin', 'https://github.com/terminalmage/gitfs-test1.git')
<git.Remote "origin">
>>> repo.git.config('http.sslVerify', 'true')
''
>>> origin = repo.remotes[0]
>>> origin.fetch()
[<git.remote.FetchInfo at 0x7f2f12da6aa0>,
 <git.remote.FetchInfo at 0x7f2f12da6af0>,
 <git.remote.FetchInfo at 0x7f2f12da6b40>]
>>> repo.refs
[<git.RemoteReference "refs/remotes/origin/master">,
 <git.RemoteReference "refs/remotes/origin/slash/test">,
 <git.TagReference "refs/tags/foo_tag">]
>>> tree = repo.refs[0].commit.tree
>>> blob = tree / 'loremipsum.txt'
>>> blob
<git.Blob "93c8ff2243c4d2e9c63850d025a25ed38a51e623">
>>> blob.size
18804
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
18804
>>> blob = tree / 'saltstack.png'
>>> blob.size
7377
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
7377
>>> blob = tree / 'imagemagick_6.7.7.10-6ubuntu4_amd64.deb'
>>> blob.size
222318
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
221818
>>> blob = tree / 'archlinux_1080p.png'
>>> blob.size
778428
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
778428
```

Note that the .deb package's data stream is not the correct size (221818 instead of 222318 as it should be).

This doesn't seem to be related to the file size, as a larger PNG image works just fine. Both the PNG images and the .deb package are marked as binary files in the .gitattributes file, as well.

comment.body:
The issue seems to be fixed with the release of [gitdb 0.6.1](https://pypi.python.org/pypi?:action=display&name=gitdb&version=0.6.1) .

Even though I put the file in question into the test-suite to assert the fix and added a few more checks to possibly find more issues of this kind, I wasn't able to find another file that showed the issue. My guess is that *high-entropy* loose object files are causing it.

The fix consists of setting the decompression buffer of the compressed loose object from 512B to 8196B, which is the same value git was using at the time I implemented it.

Please verify the issue is gone on your end as well - in the meanwhile I will see if I can find another fix that relies more on the understanding of the matter, instead of some zlib inner workings.

issue.title: Option to protect E2 code
issue.body:
I can't think of cases when anybody could want admins/owner or anybody else excluding, maybe, friends, to copy his e2 without any questions, requests, etc. Especially if he worked on it for months or even years... Yeah, there are some kind of ways to "protect", like adding "if(duped())...", "if(owner():steamID!="...")...", but they all are just too easy to overcome. Last month some of my e2s I was working on were copied for at least 4 times, and I don't wanna see them released by some thief poorly modified...
So, I am currently thinking of how can I protect my codes, and the best way I found is:
1. obfuscating e2 on client just before sending to server, 
2. including e2 code to protect from executing by another owner, encoded and hardly visible
3. making it impossible for owners/admins/anybody not allowed to read your code or dupe the e2

And I suggest adding (1) and (3) to wiremod (obfuscation can be optional in e2 settings). Also, think about adv.dupe. I think, owners and admins must be able to delete anything, but there must be no way to copy others stuff for them. And the harder it will be to overcome the better.

issue.title: Admin activation of users by email link not working if logged in to frontend
issue.body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Set up user registration to require admin to activate new users. Login to frontend as administrator in your default browser. In other browser create a new user. Once you receive the "verification" link, at the new user email address, copy and paste the link in the other browser, not your default one (where you logged in with your admin user) Click on the activation link. 

#### Expected result

 When successful, we got the message "The user's account has been successfully activated and the user has been notified about it."

#### Actual result

The default browser just shows the site frontend without message that the user has been activated.

#### System information (as much as possible)

Joomla 2.5.28-dev

#### Additional comments

Initial issue Submitted By: Torben Wölm - Open Date: 2013-09-14 03:55:07
http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/joomla/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=32007&start=0

I can reproduce the issue on 2.5.28-dev, it is still there. But it has been fixed in 3.3.x but with different PRs, revert from regression. Please help me to find what code should be back ported from 3.3.x, if possible, to fix this in 2.5.x!

issue.title: Possible change to QueryProcessor.get_iterable
issue.body:
I noticed while developing a custom `QueryProcessor` that the `get_queryset` method is called twice while servicing /api/data/preview/.

I was wondering if it would make sense to modify [get_iterable](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/avocado/blob/master/avocado/query/pipeline.py#L46-L65) to take an optional `queryset` parameter so that if the caller already had the queryset at hand, it could be reused.

The context is that in Serrano's [preview.py](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/serrano/blob/master/serrano/resources/preview.py#L46-L55), there is an explicit call to grab the queryset, but a chance for reuse is missed when `get_iterable` is called.

This change would relieve custom query processors from having to manage caching themselves if they perform heavy computations.

comment.body:
Yes. The `QueryProcessor` class is confusing and honestly was rushed at the time it was designed. For a little background, the original intent of the query processor was to:

1. Encapsulate the boilerplate logic for preparing a query and the exporter
2. Provide a way to customize the processor that can be changed at runtime

The encapsulation attempts to hide some of the side effects from the translation of a Django queryset, which is object-based, to a *Harvest query* which is row-based. The transformation between these models actually happens when the `DataView` [is applied](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/avocado/blob/master/avocado/query/oldparsers/dataview.py#L144-L149) so fields anywhere in the data model (not just on the queryset's model) can be added to the query. The `queryset.select` call in the view code ultimately calls [this modeltree method](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/modeltree/blob/master/modeltree/tree.py#L934-L969) which changes the internal `queryset.query` object. The processor ultimately [only uses](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/avocado/blob/master/avocado/query/pipeline.py#L62-L63) the internal query object since the raw query is executed.

The customization aspect is solved by the [query processor registry](https://github.com/chop-dbhi/avocado/blob/master/avocado/query/pipeline.py#L100). Multiple processors can be defined by name and selected at runtime. Although a processor *could* be a function, I chose it to be class-based with small methods so individual parts can be extended.

As you pointed out, the poor encapsulation leaks out and is confusing and I think this is an appropriate opportunity to change the implementation before the 2.4 release. Does the above make sense? How might we change this so it feels more natural? /cc @tjrivera

when you try install a generator and yo fails to install the generator (in my case because it needs to run the npm installs with sudo) it still gives you a confirmative log, which is contradictory.

npm ERR! Please try running this command again as root/Administrator.

npm ERR! ...
npm ERR! not ok code 0


I just installed a generator by running:

    npm install -g generator-angular
```

This is happening on yo 1.3.3 Mac OS X.

comment.body: @SBoudrias Looks like we need to improve post-close behavior in https://github.com/yeoman/yo/blob/master/lib/routes/install.js#L130 to correct this. I agree we should only display the installation success message when we 100% know there hasn't been a failure somewhere else in the pipeline.

issue.title: ./jtrts.pl -internal -q fails for form=osc
issue.body:
"caused" by https://github.com/magnumripper/JohnTheRipper/commit/546a203d4b673a6f15e3e25186b674e80a44fa18 which repeated the test hash in the canonical format used for john.pot.
```
(master)test $ ./jtrts.pl -internal -q
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- JtR-TestSuite (jtrts). Version 1.13, Dec 21, 2014.  By, Jim Fougeron & others
- Testing:  John the Ripper password cracker, version 1.8.0.2-jumbo-1-bleeding_omp [linux-gnu 64-bit AVX2-autoconf]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
form=osc                          guesses:    1 -show=   1 0:00:00:00 DONE : Expected count(s) (2)(-show2)  [!!!FAILED!!!]
Some tests had Errors. Performed 295 tests.  1 errors00:00 DONE  [PASSED]
Time used was 75 seconds
```
I didn't revert this JtR addition:
```
+ // repeat hash in the same form that is used in john.pot
+ {"$dynamic_4$05de5c963ee6234dc7d52f7589a1922b$ ", "welcome"},
```
Because I think it is a TS problem. (`./john --test` doesn't fail)

comment.body:
Also note, this is (in theory) how it is store in the .pot file, BUT there are no trailing spaces:

$ cat tst.pot
$dynamic_4$05de5c963ee6234dc7d52f7589a1922b$  :welcome

It works within self test code, because that does not go through the loader.c trimming.  There simply is a rule that Solar added, that right-trims the hashes.

issue.title: Suppress multiple Notifications
issue.body:
Hey folks! A few of my friends recently reported that our App displays notifications too often, especially the one with disabled `Location Services`. This makes the impression our App wants to "call home":

issue.body:
Our updater is broken (or: I have strong suspicions it is).
According to `version-0.6.0`, we check the version present on FEX based on that file being listed on [this page](http://www.mathworks.de/matlabcentral/fileexchange/22022-matlab2tikz/all_files).

But that page no longer exists, as you can see. Either we need to find a different mechanism (e.g. we could use a similar mechanism on GitHub), or we may want to look for an alternative on FEX (e.g. 

Anyway, we still want to download everything through FEX: that link should still work, and it has the added advantage that we then keep track of our popularity in FEX.
Unfortunately, this situation also means that our end-users are currently unable to get notified of updates. However, we are still 7th most popular package with about 1200 downloads per month, so there is no reason for panic :smile:

> To learn more about the current developer tooling eco-system, you may be interested in watching Paul's talk on "Better Web App Development Through Tooling" or Addy's Yeoman session on Google Developers Live.

Where "Better Web App Development Through Tooling" is a talk by @paulirish from 2012.

issue.title: React Hot Loader doesn't work if React is external (CDN)
issue.body:
Hi there,

Given:
```
module.exports = {
  externals: {
    react: 'React',
    'react/addons': 'React',
    'react-router': 'ReactRouter'
  }, ...
```

and:
```
    <script type="text/javascript" src="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/0.12.2/react-with-addons.min.js"></script>
    <script type="text/javascript" src="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react-router/0.11.6/react-router.min.js"></script>
```

in the `html`.  Then the React Hot Loader doesn't work.  I see this in the `console`:
```
[HMR] Waiting for update signal from WDS...
[WDS] Hot Module Replacement enabled.
[WDS] App updated. Recompiling...
[WDS] App updated. Recompiling...
[WDS] App hot update...
[HMR] Checking for updates on the server...
[HMR] Updated modules:
[HMR]  - 20
[HMR] App is up to date.
```

but I don't see the changes getting reflected in the view.  It'd work however If I commented out the `externals` configuration and the `script` lines in the `html` (getting webpack to use NPM react packages).

The `console` output is almost the same as above except that `[HMR] - 20` was `[HMR] - 19`.

Any suggestions on how to debug/fix this would be welcome.  Confirmation that anyone has successfully used React Hot Loader with external React resources would be great too.

comment.body:
Good catch. We [depend on](https://github.com/gaearon/react-hot-loader/blob/master/getRootInstances.js#L4) internal `react/lib/ReactMount`.

In your case, it seems that external packages are being used for React itself, but `react/lib/ReactMount` is taken from NPM package. This doesn't work because they correspond to two independent copies of React. If you delete NPM packages, it should no longer build at all.

I think it would be nice to avoid depending on `ReactMount` but then we'd need another way to get list of root instances. This could be made injectable by user but I'm not sure if it's worth the complexity.

What practical benefit does it give you to use externals in dev?

issue.title: incr/decr: the value should be part of extras according to doc
issue.body:
protocol-binary.xml states:
  Increment, Decrement
    MUST have extras.
    MUST have key.
    MUST NOT have value.

but memcached did not set extlen for incr and decr responses.  Most client
applications didn't appear to care, they just used the 8 bytes of the body
as the delta value and thus should not break when incr and decr start saying
the new value is in extras.

comment.body:
AFAICT this Java client won't break, it treats all data as 'payload': https://github.com/dustin/java-memcached-client/blob/master/src/main/java/net/spy/memcached/protocol/binary/MutatorOperationImpl.java#L69

But the Dalli ruby client will break: https://github.com/mperham/dalli/blob/master/lib/dalli/server.rb#L324 https://github.com/mperham/dalli/blob/master/lib/dalli/server.rb#L491

So maybe we just need to update protocol documentation and protocol_binary.h to match the implementation.   Or do something different: add a protocol version number to requests (using `reserved`?) and fix the implementation when using newer protocol version.

issue.title: learnyounode : juggeling async

comment.body:
"not working" is not the best problem description. In general it will be easier for people to help if you describe what you want or expect to happen, and then describe what is happening, sometimes simply making these descriptions will help you solve problem.

Here are a few things I noticed about your code:
 - You are looping over `process.argv[1]` to `process.argv[3]` but command line arguments start at `process.argv[2]`, so you should be looping over `process.argv[2]` to `process.argv[4]`
 - your `file1` function never passes any data to the callback
 - your `file1` function never calls the callback with errors
 - you do a `http.get` for all 3 urls, but you don't save the data anywhere.

Keeping track with `callbackCounter` is a good plan, but you need to save the data somewhere, so that once the counter hits 3, you can log it.

issue.title: Should not set/use a default password for apt-acng
issue.body:
Providing default passwords is not such a good idea. We should force the admin to choose some password (even if he chooses "password" then). Best would be to not provide a default and *fail and stop processing this host* if the password is not supplied. 

Implementation:
* Change default to `""` (empty string) in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L91
* Remove fall back to default in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/templates/etc/apt-cacher-ng/security.conf.j2#L12 (these are useless anyway, because defaults are ensured to be defined in `defaults/main.yml`)
* Add a `fail` in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/tasks/configure_acng_server.yml#L5.

comment.body: There's always an option to specify password via `debops.secret` role. :-) `debops.apt` is old and needs an overhaul. `apt-cacher-ng` should be moved to a separate role.

issue.title: piaware blocks waiting for netstat output
issue.body:
netstat without -n can take a long time to complete (minutes!) as it needs to do reverse-DNS on potentially a long list of addresses, many of which might time out.

piaware blocks while it waits for this output, which isn't great.

Best option would be to pass -n, but you'd have to do something about explicitly looking for "eyes.flightaware.com" then.

comment.body: https://github.com/mutability/piaware/commit/472af67d73130359456157fbb9057bbbce2c79c9 may be a useful starting point for you

issue.title: smarter BoundsError reporting
issue.body:
BoundsError() made me sad (so I fixed it)

this adds argument information to intrinsic bounds checking operations, optimized to have no added impact on the runtime cost, in the common case of not having an error

  of (Int64,Int64...)
  at index [3]

issue.title: Support CPU affinity on FreeBSD
issue.body:
It seems, [getting/setting CPU affinity](http://pythonhosted.org/psutil/#psutil.Process.cpu_affinity) is not supported on FreeBSD:

```
Python 2.7.8 (a980ebb26592ed26706cd33a4e05eb45b5d3ea09, Dec 13 2014, 07:55:06)
[PyPy 2.4.0 with GCC 4.2.1 Compatible FreeBSD Clang 3.4.1 (tags/RELEASE_34/dot1-final 208032)] on freebsd10
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>> import psutil
>>>> psutil.__version__
'2.1.3'
>>>> p = psutil.Process()
>>>> p.cpu_affinity()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: 'Process' object has no attribute 'cpu_affinity'
>>>>
```

comment.body:
Fantastic! I've tested trunk: works as expected .. cool. We are using psutil in https://github.com/crossbario/crossbar .. and this feature is highly appreciated.

Test system: FreeBSD 10.1 amd64 PyPy 2.4

* Building spits out some minor warnings: https://gist.github.com/oberstet/de48b9a7effa4a0754ad
* API works: https://gist.github.com/oberstet/78971b18970c5b1d8744
* And finally, running a TCP echo server with and without affinity set actually shows it *does* work http://picpaste.com/pics/Clipboard01-sgocv9h8.1420126580.png

Thank you very much! Ah, and happy new year;)

issue.title: urlManager problem with empty string url rule
issue.body:
In config I have:
```php
'defaultRoute' => '/front/view/index',
```
Default start page have gridView with sorting and pagination, whos links are like:
```php
/front/view/index?sort=date
/front/view/index?page=2
```
But I want them to be like:
```php
/?sort=date
/?page=2
```
So I try to add URL rules like:
```php
'' => '/front/view/index',
// OR
'/' => '/front/view/index',
```
But they does not work, links still starts with `/front/view/index`. I think this may be a bug.
Also, I found a tricky solution:
```php
'<s:$>' => '/front/view/index',
```
This make links as I wanted `/?page=2`, but it make excess "s" parameter, that is not good for clean coding.

comment.body: Looks like a bug as it seems to be working for `'' => 'front/view/index',` but not for `'' => '/front/view/index',`.

issue.body:
Hello Courseplay team,

This idea began while testing #832 "Mais harvesting with poetinger mex 5" and the provided fix. As this is a new question/idea/request I decided to open a new "Issue" instead of placing this in the other thread.

With Mex5 attached at tractor front and using Courseplay v256 works now perfect.

I did a little research and found at Mex5 manufacturer home page (Pöttinger, see also links at the end) that it is also/more common to attach a Mex5 at the back of a tractor and then driving backward at harvest. I tried this configuration in LS 15 together with Courseplay v256... 

Initial the transport tractor driven by Courseplay joins the harvester in the "wrong" direction (screenshot 1). So I stopped Courseplay at transport tractor. After I start Coursplay again at transport tractor the transport follows my backward driving harvester (screenshot 2) very good/as expected ;-) ... 

So my question: Is there an easy way to implement something like a "default backward/forward driving" flag to indicate the normal driving direction for such a harvest combine? So the transport would be able to evaluate such a flag and already initially joins in the "right" driving direction... 

Or is this just a nut idea from my side as this is not a very common usage of CP in LS 15?

issue.title: Apply inline
issue.body:
In preparation for the Spring 15 Call for Students, I've been working on improving our application flow in a branch called `apply-inline` and wanted to share my progress here. 

We shouldn't merge this until the call is ready to go out, but thought we could discuss what I changed, and what's left to do in this Pull Request thread. I think it's really close!

## Nav

- Top navigation now links to `Participate` which is information about the call, and `Apply` which is the actual form. Bootstrap has a cool little highlighted label where I put the date, but we could also do a countdown.

![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 8 08 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591426/d739785e-9128-11e4-9c03-d373322ce58f.png)

## Participate

1. Short "Open Calls" introduction with buttons for **Apply Now** (jumps to: Apply) or **Read More** (jumps down to full text of Call for Students)
2. Alumni testimonials sidebar, (editable via `/_data/testimonials.yml`) (fixes #61?)
3. "Scenes from School" slideshow (we should add more images)
4. Full text of Spring 2015 Call for Students

![participate school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591348/7cbc3be0-9124-11e4-8e4d-4e5692bcdf89.png)

## Apply

1. Migrating from Google Forms (off-site form, spreadsheet backend, free) to Formkeep (on-site form, very usable backend, pay what you wish).
  - With Google Forms we didn't have much control over how the application looked, and answers were stored in a hard to read spreadsheet.
  - Formkeep is simply an endpoint that accepts answers from a form on our site, displays the answers in a much more readable backend, and allows us to search applications and mark spam if necessary.
2. Application is editable via `/_data/application.json`, and is completely customizable.
3. Sidebar shows application/admissions timeline and helpful hints.

![apply school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591350/809b6d3a-9124-11e4-94a8-46257ddf3a36.png)

## Thanks

1. After a successful submit, thank the applicant and shower them with virtual confetti. (Looks really smooth in the browser, the GIF just has a low frame rate.)
2. Added prompts to share the Participate page on Facebook and Twitter

![thanks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591351/88f8d616-9124-11e4-926f-c1cb65eb7783.gif)

## (Optional) Share Prompts

- There are optional, and we can customize what they say/how they look by adding some metadata tags, if anyone has edits.

| Twitter | Facebook |
| --------- | ------------- |
| ![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 7 01 37 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591266/8b09f0f2-911f-11e4-8ead-75f9a25cffe0.png) | ![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 7 01 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591268/8e1f18c6-911f-11e4-8cf7-a574620c1451.png) |

## FAQ

- Has a new Table of Contents navigation, which sticks to the screen as you scroll and highlights the answer you're on.

![faq school for poetic computation 20141231](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591352/8ed4deae-9124-11e4-9bcc-846c2eefaaec.png)

## Formkeep Backend

- This is what Formkeep looks like.

![screen shot 2014-12-31 at 6 58 21 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/462020/5591257/4e894a38-911f-11e4-8cc9-95e66249a978.png)

- - -

## Missing Pieces

I'm excited about all this! Hope you are too.

Here's what's left to do:

- Add in new FAQ content, once finalized (via `/_faqs/section.md`)
- Final application questions (via `/_data/application.json`)
- Final application schedule  (via `/layouts/apply.html`)
- Any design/flow tweaks you might think of
- Internal testing (it worked for me, but would be great to kick the tires.)

comment.body:

issue.title: Ability to catch and rewrite backend's tab-completion responses
issue.body:
###### The issue:
It is not currently possible to catch tab-completion responses from backend servers (e.g. Spigot) to clients. However, this would be a helpful feature, since currently, to block tab-completion responses, server owners have to install a plugin on every backend server. 
###### Problems:
- [x] I have already created (nearly) working code<sup>[1]</sup> to resolve above issue, but I am unable to get it to write changes in the suggestions back to the packet. I have thought of possible fixes for that, but couldn't find any clean ones: 
  - writing to `buf` directly from the `DownstreamBridge#handle(TabCompleteResponse)` method would require a reference to the `PacketWrapper`
  - re-writing the `buf` in `#handle(PacketWrapper)` would require an ugly `instanceof` or handling in `EntityMap`
  - Changes in the API to allow for this would probably not be accepted just to support such a small event that I am not sure how many people could actually use.
- [x] I am not sure if this kind of event suits the goal of BungeeCord, ~~since I have not been able to find any code that rewrites backend->client (except `EntityMap`, but that's something else).~~

###### Use cases:
 - Block commands blocked by users from appearing in tab completions globally, reducing administration effort of copying configuration files for [xxyy/CommandBlockerUltimate](https://github.com/xxyy/CommandBlockerUltimate)
 - Block names of vanished players globally (thanks @Schmoller)
 - Keep Spigot backend tab completions while adding or removing your own stuffs 
 -  completes  the tab complete API with a counterpart to `TabCompleteEvent`.

###### Relevant links:
- [I wanted to put something else here, but I forgot what, so take a link to the related plugin](https://github.com/xxyy/commandblockerultimate/)

<sup>[1]</sup> ~~I accidentally the imports, I will fix that once I get the confirmation that this PR has the chance of being pulled.~~

What I want to ask you for is clarification on whether such changes would be suitable for BungeeCord and, if so, some advice on properly writing back changes. 

*Thanks.*

comment.body:
This is something I currently use in a fork for our server for preventing vanished player names from being tab completed in either commands or chat.

If you're looking for a reason why this fits in BungeeCord, its the other side of the TabComplete coin, you have one direction covered, why not the other? Also it would remove one more thing from my fork :P

issue.title: [IMPORTANT] Repo split and new continuous- integration bot
issue.body:
Due to Travis not being flexible enough (and also very slow), me and hakan have setup a Jenkins server that tracks PRs and also builds CKAN/ NetKAN from master. It works pretty much the same as Travis except it's a lot faster, more reliable and configurable.

The following repositories are tracked for changes. All PRs will be built and you will see the build result the same way it was with Travis.
- [CKAN-core](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-core)
- [CKAN-cmdline](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-cmdline) 
- [CKAN-GUI](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-GUI) 
- [CKAN-netkan](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-netkan)
- [CKAN-meta](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-meta)
- [NetKAN](http://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN)

The server itself is at http://ci.ksp-ckan.org, you can login using your GitHub account.
The latest ckan.exe can be found [here](http://128.199.40.123:8080/job/CKAN/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ckan.exe).
Latest netkan.exe is [here](http://128.199.40.123:8080/job/NetKAN/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/netkan.exe).
You can follow the Jenkins build logs in #ckan-jenkins at irc.esper.net.
All CKAN/ NetKAN merges get automatic releases in the [CKAN-nightly repo](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-nightly/releases).

The replacement for `.travis.yml` comes in the form of a simple bash script associated with each project called `build.sh`.

What works?
- Pretty much everything
- NUnit tests
- PRs are tracked and reported on
- PRs to the NetKAN PR will be inflated with the latest netkan.exe and installed with the latest ckan.exe (hooray!)
- PRs to the CKAN-meta PR will be installed with the latest ckan.exe

What's doesn't?
- All tests that use 'prove' are not implemented, need @pjf 's help on this one
- MirrorKAN needs to be patched
- GitHub releases

**Final verdict  =>  from PR to build in 15 seconds instead of 5 minutes.**

comment.body:
***How to make releases using the new build system***

While not super-automated like the last system was, we do now have a relatively nice way to make new releases using the ckan-release-promoter.py tool. Here is a step-by-step guide on how to do that.

1) Pick [a release from CKAN-nighly](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-nightly/releases) that you want to promote to an official release and copy its Jenkins build URL. For example, if I choose [build 152](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-nightly/releases/tag/jenkins-CKAN-152) I will need "http://ci.ksp-ckan.org:8080/job/CKAN/152/"
2) Clone KSP-CKAN/CKAN, all of our build tools are there for now
3) Navigate to CKAN/bin
4) Run `python ckan-release-promoter.py <args>`, where the necessary arguments are described below:
`--user USER` - Your GitHub username
`--token TOKEN` - Your GitHub password (or app. token)
`--repository REPOSITORY` - The repository in which to create the release, you want this to be `KSP-CKAN/CKAN` for now
`--jenkins-build URL` - The build URL from step 1
`--release-version VERSION` - The CKAN version to stamp the .exe with, should be in the format vX.Y.Z e.g. v1.5.1
`--name NAME` - The name of the release e.g. "Galactic Center"
`--draft` - Optional, post the release as a draft, defaults to false
`--prerelease` - Optional, post the release as a pre-release, defaults to false

issue.title: SpeechDispatcher:  Reconnect to server if connection is dropped.
issue.body:
Currently the SpeechDispatcher TTS plugin only connects to the speech dispatcher server once.  If that connection is dropped, it never retries to gain - just logs the following error:
`ERROR o.o.i.m.i.t.SpeechDispatcherConnection[:67]- Error sending text to SpeechDispatcher Host 127.0.0.1: not connected to server`
The only existing recovery was to restart openhab.

This simple Pull Request adds a check to see if the plugin has been disconnected from the server and reconnects automatically.

issue.title: Make output_format matching more robust.
issue.body:
The issue at https://github.com/ruby-av/paperclip-av-transcoder/issues/3
is caused, at least on my system with Paperclip 4.2, by the format
parameter of the form: ".FMT".  This caused the case statement to not
match any of the desired formats!  It's likely that other paperclip
version don't pass the dot before the format extension, but it seems
likely that the behavior may differ depending on the version.

This change looks for the end of the format string to match using a
regex, and should now properly find the format, allowing thumbnails
to be generated (as well as the proper switches for non image params)

comment.body: whoops.  I'll look into that.  thanks.

issue.title: breaking change in atom-shell 0.20.3 build
issue.body:
The 'atom.gyp' rigging needs to be fixed for atom-shell 0.20.3 and beyond. The upstream build process has changed in order to make this customization simpler. Now the suggested method of renaming is:

```shell
export GYP_DEFINES="product_name=MyApp project_name=myapp"
./script/update.py
./script/build.py -C Release -t myapp
```

In grunt-build-atom-shell 1.1.4, attempting to compile atom-shell 0.20.3 will throw the following error:

```
>> Running: python script/bootstrap.py
>> Running: python script/build.py -c Release -t triple-triad-atom
>> ninja: error: unknown target 'triple-triad-atom'
```

The 'atom.gyp' file ends up containing:

```
    'project_name%': 'atom',
    'product_name%': 'Atom',
```

Dealing with quoting and interpolation for multiple options in a single string feels weird for me, so it might just be simpler to add another two replace statements for the new form. I haven't looked at the changes in depth to see what else might have changed (or if those defines are used in other places).

If I get un-lazy I'll patch and submit a pull quest, but considering i'm both lazy and hung over you'll probably get to it first. :laughing:

comment.body: i left a line comment with a github ping to the committer... dunno if i should follow that up with an actual issue or if that's sufficient. I don't want to be that guy that pokes someone repeatedly over the holidays. ;)

issue.title: Fixed "Cannot read property 'ngIf' of undefined" when using ng-elif within a test suite.
issue.body:
I'm using ng-elif in my project and when I run the test suite I get "Cannot read property 'ngIf' of undefined". The change I made to fix this involves splitting out `getter` to `getter` (the original var), and `getterFn` (what gets assigned when running `$injector.invoke(getter)`. There doesn't seem to be any runtime changes in behavior and my app uses ng-else-if and ng-else quite a bit.

Thanks for the awesome directive!

issue.title: Bookmark duplicates policy
issue.body:
When a bookmark is saved and user navigates on the same page and clicks on the address field star or chooses "Add bookmark" from the menu, a dialogue informs the user that such bookmark already exists. When the user chooses to continue from there, a new bookmark dialogue opens up. 

I have a suggestion to enhance this behaviour with an option in about:config AllowDuplicateBookmarks true/false. Both options would give the same warning as described, but when the duplicates policy is set to "false", the new bookmark dialogue would contain the existing bookmark data. 

I mean, when AllowDuplicateBookmarks is false, then selecting "Add bookmark" on a page already bookmarked, the user would see the existing bookmark edit dialogue, not adding a new dialogue. 

And the "This bookmark already exists. Continue?" dialogue should have three options: 1. Yes 2. Cancel 3. Never show this message again

And about:config should contain an option to get the dialogue back.

comment.body: Treating them differently is intentional, it will make more sens after finishing #510 (global action will have fixed text).

issue.title: mon: provide encoded canonical full OSDMap from primary
issue.body:
Currently we make each monitor apply the incremental and encode the full
map locally.  The original motivation was to save bandwidth, but the
savings are minimal to modest and the complexity associated with doing this
is huge.

This strategy also causes problems now that we have OSDMap crc's and old
mons/clusters may have diverging full OSDMaps due to mixed version
clusters.  See #10422

Instead, include the encoded full map in the paxos transaction.  We will
still apply the incremental and check the crc, but if it fails and we have
the correct version, reload it from disk and move on.  If we don't, we
will continue as we have before--the primary mon doesn't have support for
crc's yet.  When it does we will start verifying and/or get our
full map back into sync.

Fixes: #10422
Signed-off-by: Sage Weil <sage@redhat.com>

comment.body:
looks okay.

As far as I can tell, the whole idea about relying solely on incremental to locally build full osdmaps goes as back as a5e2dcb33d915dca26558909647e2e56ed1c23f4. This has me believe that while the idea may have seemed good at the time it may not have been based on a real issue.

Anyway, relaying a few MB's worth of osdmap (if it gets to that) over the wire doesn't concern me particularly -- the one thing that may be annoying is writing them to leveldb.

I fear that writing a just-big enough map to leveldb may cause a hang;  while we do now have the async mechanism to handle this, I fear that we may end up waiting for a big transaction to be applied to leveldb before accepting the value (e.g.,  in Paxos::handle_begin() we will wait for the value to be applied to the store before we send out MMonPaxos::OP_ACCEPT).  Then again, this can easily be something surmountable by adjusting timeouts if we ever hit it.

Näyttää siltä, että projekti on edennyt hyvää vauhtia. Näköjään sinulle ei ole merkitty mitään suunnitelmasta ja ensimmäisen viikon palautuksesta, vaikkakin ne on tehty ajoissa. Laitan suunnitelmasta 3p ja raporteista 2p. En näe niissä mitään moitittavaa. Ehkä helpoin tapa saada melko tarkasti kääntyvä robotti on tehdä siitä kolmipyöräinen, joista ei-vetävä pyörä kääntyy kaikkiin suuntiin samaan tapaan kuin ostoskärryn pyörä.

issue.title: adding newsyslog user and group permission for jenkins user
issue.body:
This fix is based on this issue: https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-23543

Essentially, when newsyslog runs it will change the log to have root permissions. This will cause jenkins to silently fail and to not be able to restart on OSX. 

I have tested this change on Yosemite, Mavericks, and Mountain Lion.

comment.body: The change to `osx/scripts/postinstall-launchd` seems wrong, as it assigns permissions for `/var/log/jenkins/jenkins.log` to `jenkins:jenkins`, when its parent directory is made owned by `daemon:daemon` just a few lines above. In fact, `jenkins:jenkins` should only exist/be created if a custom option gets set during installation.

issue.title: allow configuration of callback URL to ihat
issue.body: When trying to set up Tahi via fig, I was finding that the automatically generated callback URL `http://localhost:8080/ihat_jobs` did not work, because localhost would resolve different in the container used for ihat. This is a workaround for this issue. It's not the best solution, but I can't think of a better one.

comment.body:
I think that should be addressed in how the app is configured. The [`_url` route helpers](http://guides.rubyonrails.org/routing.html#path-and-url-helpers) will include the "path prefixed with the current host, port and path prefix."

I wonder whether that's possible to rely on in development?

issue.title: Decouple from Grunt
issue.body:
We're at the point where a number of our most popular generators do not use Grunt. With this in mind, I think we should consider dropping or refactoring the messaging on our homepage to make it clear `yo` can be used to scaffold out a setup with any tooling choices.

Depending on how far we wanted to take it we could illustrate this point with examples.

E.g: 
Yo works great with Grunt. Check out generator-webapp.
Yo also works great with Gulp. Checkout generator-gulp-webapp.
It even works well with X, Y and Z which have nothing to do with either of these options.

If we decide to do this properly, we would also need to refactor the learning section of the site. Thoughts?

issue.title: Add `retry` attribute to cache purging code.
issue.body:
There is an annoying problem with `nscd` daemon on Ubuntu systems that service startup script exits before the nscd daemon is actually available. As a consequence, `nscd -i TABLE` command fails if executed
immediately after service restart. Retrying it after a short timeout fixes the problem.

issue.title: Pioneer doesn't start on OSX Yosemite or Win7
issue.body: Both graphics cards claim to support openGL 3.3 and have the latest drivers.  For the mac, I click the application and it bounces for a little bit, then disappears.  I've tried the version that the FAQ mentions and it keeps freezing.  For the windows, it opens, but get's stuck in the loading screen.  Anything I'm doing wrong?  Permissions issue possibly? comment.body:
Yeah the only change is to retry with a different combination of context/profile flags. OSX forces a certain combination for versions of OpenGL above 3.1 but the alternatives might work better on some hardware than others. Worth a try. 

We really need someone who has this specific problem to give this a try.

issue.title: (WIP) Razor engine update.
issue.body:
This reverts commit 1289f612a8d34279add6cffbcdf5eaa1d14c05e4 and updates RazorEngine to version 3.5.0-beta2 (paket doesnt like beta1).
The problem with the previous commit was that upstream projects broke (because of a different dependency).
This time we use the official update of the RazorEngine project.

@forki: I again have a problem with paket. With this change `paket install` will not work:

    Paket failed with:

    Error in resolution.
      Resolved:
        - FAKE 3.12.2
        - RazorEngine 3.5.0-beta2
        - NuGet.CommandLine 2.8.3
        - NUnit 2.6.4
        - NUnit.Runners 2.6.4
        - Microsoft.AspNet.Razor 2.0.30506.0
        - CommandLineParser 1.9.71
        - FSharp.Compiler.Service 0.0.67
      Can't resolve:
        - Microsoft.AspNet.Razor >= 3.0.0
           - from RazorEngine 3.5.0-beta2
     Please try to relax some conditions.

`paket update` worked fine and everything seems to be ok within the project files. Any hint would be very welcome, can we ignore this?
Another thing I noticed: paket seems to add dependencies to the FsLib project files while they do not have any paket.references and they dont need them.

Happy New Year to all who read this :)

issue.title: Patch received from Christian Kellermann (@ckeen).
issue.body:
Without this diff the warnings in weechat_otr.py:1203 and following are
misleading as the code path continues on and despite the promise not to
send any unencrypted text over the wire the message is sent anyway.

So this patch sets the result back to the empty string and does not
return with the current block by putting the following instruction into
an else branch.

issue.title: Make it work on Windows! Please...!
issue.body:
Hello, I've been writing in Hack from month with @steelbrain and it is an awesome project.

I've been using Windows from a long time and cannot convert to Ubuntu or any other just because I want to use HHVM, so, I'm using HHVM through a Ubuntu virtual machine. But there are a lot of downsides to it, it is slow, the kernel events on files dont work so I cannot use hh_client. And for the same reason I cannot use Autocomplete plugin for Atom or the syntax checker. It is painful.

Now I'm sure a lot of other people on Windows are doing the same or similar to use HHVM (@steelbrain has done it for a long time). I'm using it to write a website engine like WordPress in Hack, it is called [QuickPress](https://github.com/raeesiqbal/QuickPress), its not complete yet but it processes a page in ~4ms and is not good enough because I cannot use Syntax checking or Autocomplete or anyother great features in my editor.

I know that you are very awesome people and you CAN make this happen, so, please make it work on cygwin. (if you wish) I'll send you some chocolates also, if thee can make this dream come true.

comment.body: I did mention this above: If it has errors about undefined function "tbb::..." when linking, `vi hphp/hhvm/CMakeFiles/hhvm.dir/link.txt` and add `-ltbb -L/bin`.

issue.title: Contributorへの追加申請
issue.body:
恐縮です。

ところで、もう１つ報告事項があります。

WindowsXP + VMWare 5.5 + FreeBSD 9.3 の環境で、`pkg install qt5 libGLU povray37`として
(a) `gmake CC=clang CXX=clang++ Qt`
(b) `gmake Qt`
すると、以下2点の問題が起こりました。

・(a)(b)共に、/usr/local/includeがINCLUDE_PATHに入ってなくて 'GL/gl.h' file not found に、
　/usr/local/libがLIBRARY_PATHに入ってなくて-lGLUがリンクエラーになりました。
　src/Qt/FullereneViewer.pro の!macx:unix{}の所を
    INCLUDEPATH += /usr/local/include
    LIBS += -L/usr/local/lib -lGLU
　にすると、コンパイルが通りました。
　
・(a)でできた実行ファイルは、起動時にBus errorで落ちました。
　gdbで止めてみましたが、シンボル付きの実行ファイルなのにシンボルが一切表示されず、何も分かりませんでした。
　(b)でできた実行ファイルは、正常に起動しました。

以上、Mac + VirtualBox + FreeBSD 9.3でも、同じでした。
別件なので、Issue #49には書きませんでした。

よろしくお願い致します。

comment.body:
あけましておめでとうございます。
本年もよろしくお願い申し上げます。

issue.title: Bundle Collision with SGM file
issue.body:
# Description:
We have an optimised & preprocessed file format called SGM that was written by Luomu but, for some reason, we don't ship SGM files in with the main distribution. Part of that reason was that it helped loading times a lot but not as much as it could have due to the collision mesh generation being excluded from it.

With the merging of #3099 giving us 3 very complex new space stations and very complex collision meshes I've tried to add support for serialising and deserialising the collision meshes into our SGM format.

## Distribution:
With this change it would make sense to build the `.SGM` files in-place, delete the `.DAE` from the build and only have them in Git and `pioneer-assets`. 
This way players don't have to worry about having the correct files or building `.SGM` versions.

# Loading times:
A quick comparison, please note that this is done on my laptop with a 512GiB SSD so there's little variation due to disk access, but possibly some due to thermal throttling/behaviour.

## SGM Load times:
I did 3 runs and the times were
* Loading took: 23865.460385 milliseconds
* Loading took: 23486.056590 milliseconds
* Loading took: 23832.089322 milliseconds
For an average of **~23727.87** milliseconds.

## Standard Load times:
Once again but with no SGM files.
* Loading took: 128687.466982 milliseconds
* Loading took: 126967.270705 milliseconds
* Loading took: 126556.816863 milliseconds
For an average of **~127403.85** milliseconds

## Result:
This means that using SGM files with the collision mesh data results in the game loading to the intro screen **~5.37** times faster.

# At the Command line:
**WARNING**: The SGM files this creates will be chosen in preference to the original data in future so you might miss updates to files. Best to delete all of these SGM files after experimenting with this **WARNING**

To recreate the SGM files you just need to build the ModelCompiler, this should be shipped with the binaries versions, or you can build it yourself. It's built alongside Pioneer.
Simply go to the Pioneer folder where ModelCompiler & Pioneer reside, open a prompt / terminal and enter something like: `modelcompiler -b inplace`
That will create an SGM file for every model in the game and place it next to it's `.model` file.

# Status:
Worth testing, as I've just fixed the bug I had caused and collision now works again. Loads fast and works!

I've chosen to **compress** all of the SGM files the modelcompilier produces as this results in a reduction from ~132MB down to just ~39.5MB which is a significant reduction. It does have a negative impact on the loading times, raising it from an average 20 seconds to 24 seconds. However I think this is more than worth it.

Andy

comment.body: Tested with Linux/Windows with and without sgm files, it's no worse without and them and much better with them so have merged.

issue.title: generic linear-algebra functions for Number types (e.g. BigFloat)
issue.body:
It would be nice to have linear-algebra functions for `BigFloat` (possibly as an external package?) and other generic `Number` types.

Currently, `\` on a `BigFloat` converts to `Float64`; `eig` and `qr` don't work at all.

The good news is that LINPACK-style triple-loop textbook implementations (straight out of Trefethen or Golub & Van Loan) should mostly suffice.  Since `BigFloat` operations are CPU-limited rather than memory-limited, there is no reason to implement a LAPACK/BLAS-style blocked algorithm.

cc: @andrioni

comment.body: @paulanalyst This should be reported at https://github.com/andreasnoack/LinearAlgebra.jl

issue.title: Help of miniconda windows installer is missing doc for silent install mode
issue.body:
Hi,

I was using the Miniconda windows installer from http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html.

A windows with the following text shows up, when running `Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /?`:
```
Usage Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe [options]
Options:

/InstallationType=AllUsers [default: JustMe]

/AddToPath=[0|1] [default: 1]

/RegisterPython=[0|1] [default: AllUsers: 1, JustMe: 0]

Examples:
Install for all users, but don't add to PATH env var:
Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /InstallationType=AllUsers
/AddToPath=0

Install for just me, but register the system Python:
Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /RegisterPython=1
```

This option list is missing the already! available options
```
/S

/D=C:\Miniconda
```
for silent install mode (unattended install mode) and the installation directory respectively.

Also the documentation on http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html, or http://conda.pydata.org/docs/index.html are not mentioning the command line options of the installer for conda / e.g. miniconda.

The only hint I could find was: http://docs.continuum.io/anaconda/install.html#windows-install.

I was "greping" for the miniconda installation options (i.e. `AddToPath`) in the conda repo, but couldn't find the source.

I am happy to add a options section to https://github.com/conda/conda-docs however, a far as I see, the installation process of miniconda is not explained at all. I was looking for something analogous to http://docs.continuum.io/anaconda/install.html... how and where would you put such a doc?

issue.title: dist/material-styleguide.html doesn't load correctly [material-sprint]
issue.body:
In the material-sprint branch, the statically-built version of `material-styleguide.html` (i.e. the version in `dist/material-styleguide.html` created by `gulp`) usually doesn't load correctly from localhost--the main content frame appears to be blank.

To reproduce:

````sh
$ git checkout material-sprint
$ gulp
$ cd dist
$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer
$ open http://localhost:8000/material-styleguide.html # no content in main frame >50% of the time
````

This seems to happen if the browser is able to load the styleguide-demo iframes before sizeDemo() is [able to attach the onload handlers](https://github.com/google/web-starter-kit/blob/material-sprint/app/material-styleguide.html#L174), and so some are never called, which means the `demosLoaded` class is never added to `<body>`. (Which is more likely to happen if loading from localhost, without browser-sync being involved.)

comment.body:
I've been able to reproduce this locally. We're currently rewriting the material-styleguide.html implementation to move away from iframes as much as possible. This work hasn't yet been checked in to the material-sprint branch, but soon you will just have a static HTML file with all of the markup existing in the same file so this issue will disappear.

cc @gauntface as an FYI that this is currently occurring.

issue.title: Tabular columns in mathmode (for .html and others)
issue.body:
When we write code like the following in `.xml` ``` d (days worked)p (cents)1 2 2 4 3 8 4 16 5 32 10 1024 30 1073741824
``` we translate into `.tex` and receive ``` \begin{tabular}{S[table-format=2.0]S[table-format=10.0]} \beforeheading \heading{$d$ (days worked)}&\heading{$p$ (cents)}\\ \afterheading 1 &2 \\\normalline 2 &4 \\\normalline 3 &8 \\\normalline 4 &16 \\\normalline 5 &32 \\\normalline 10 &1024 \\\normalline 30 &1073741824\\\lastline \end{tabular} ``` The `.tex` version uses the `siunitx` package which automatically puts each entry into mathmode. The `.html` version isn't quite as clever--any ideas on how we can fix this? One possible (clumsy, heavy) solution is to put each entry into a new tag, perhaps `` for 'conditional mathmode' which would do nothing in the `.tex` version, and put the entry into `mathmode` for `.html` and other versions. In such a scheme the above snippet might look like, for example, ```1 2 2 4 ``` This raises a more general question: when we hit questions/issues such as this, should we stop until they're resolved, or just plough forward?

comment.body:
I like the syntax you're suggesting, it makes a lot of sense. The only part of it that worries me is the implementation (!)....

If we go down this route of re-building an `siunit`-style syntax, should we re-build all of the other `LaTeX` syntax as well, e.g `\frac{1}{2}`? Or is that a separate issue?

issue.title: Improve LogEvent timestamp logging
issue.body:
In log events tiestamps look like  at="Fri Dec 19 14:47:44 CET 2014.86"
After the change it will look like at="Fri Dec 19 14:47:44.086 CET 2014"

comment.body:
Yes Date.toString() uses Locale.US, I checked it before ;)

I would be very careful when you do df as a static. SimplaDateFormat is not thread safe. (I have a bad experience when I did once df static - in production). It seems to me that LogEvent.dump() **can be called by different threads, and this will lead to disaster.**
I assumed that, multiple creation is a little slower but it works properly. I do not know how much slower.

Other ways to to deal with this problem: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10411944/java-text-simpledateformat-not-thread-safe Will review what are the possibilities.

issue.title: [WIP] major refactoring of architecture
issue.body:
|Q            |A  |
|---          |---|
|Bug Fix?     |yes|
|New Feature? |yes |
|BC Breaks?   |*yes!** |
|Deprecations?|no |
|Fixed Tickets| #26  |
|License      |MIT|

This a major refactoring of the search system architecture.

In summary the following has changed;

## ConditionOptimizers 

Formatters are renamed to ConditionOptimizers, and have an optional priority for sorting.

## Input processor changes

View to normalized value transformation now happens in the Input processor.
The SearchConditionBuilder does not use this technique.

Range bounds are now validated when processing, and not as an *optional* process afterwards.

To make InputProcessors reusable, configuration must be provided as first parameter of `process()`.

And last, all processors when testing now share the same assertions to ensure a correct result.

## Values 

To make locking the SearchCondition state easier and enforce a stricter OOP architecture value objects are now immutable and marked final.

`PatternMatch::getViewValue()` is removed as this method doesn't make sense for a string-only value object.

## Symfony validator

The Symfony validator extension is **finally** moved to its own repository and package.
As constraint validation is no longer needed for validating range-bounds.

## TODO

- [ ] Add support for locking the ValuesGroup and FieldSet.
- [ ] Check documentation for inconsistent usage of terms.
- [ ] Make tests for exporters uniform (same like input).
- [ ] Look for missing tests and documentation.

issue.title: Use photo's stored elsewhere on the system
issue.body:
Hi,

Not really a bug report, but a feature request as you will.

I stumbled upon your beautiful and easy-to-use Photo-Management-System and together with @GustavePate his lycheesync plugin I thought to have finally found _the_ gallery software I was looking for. But Gustave's plugin seems to be copying my local photo folder to Lychee instead if "indexing" it and using the local photo folder as source to serve the original photo.

Is it possible with Lychee to use an existing photo repository (like /data/photos/*) and "Index" that folder structure into Lychee? Not modifying the original repo in the process, storing generated thumbnails etc. inside the Lychee directory and/or Database.

Making that possible would in my opinion be super useful and the only Photo-Management-System in the world capable of doing that.

Ralf.

comment.body:
Hi, I really like the idea and this has been discussed very often, but Lychee needs it's own structure. Changing this would require a lot of adjustments and would not work with existing installations. It's a decision which should have been done different before starting with the project. More here: https://github.com/electerious/Lychee/issues/233

What would be possible: Storing Lychee's structure in a different folder (but I guess that's not what you want)

issue.title: Loop fix
issue.body:
Converted most of the `while True` loops to explicit `for` loops looping over a length after which the pattern repeats, then raise an error if the pattern hasn't broken by then. This should produce a desirable behavior that fixes #4 (though I think that there are certain endless-loop conditions which I'm currently only detecting in the iterator, not the constructor, because checking them in the constructor would involve a much more complicated logic because they involve interactions between the `byhour`, `byminute` and/or `bysecond` rules - either way I think they're likely exceedingly rare in practice).

I did a little refactoring in the looping logic, but not much since I think a lot of it won't end up being used in `rrule2` anyway. I'm a bit curious as to why we're explicitly handling the low-level operations of incrementing the day rather than incrementing a `datetime.datetime` object using `datetime.timedelta` objects - is this for the sake of performance or something? I can't imagine it would add much overhead, and it would be much easier to maintain.

I also converted the `by_` tuples to sets, because it doesn't seem that their order is ever used, but there are frequent calls to `in`, which will be considerably sped up by the use of sets. While I was doing that, I did some refactoring in the constructor which will make it easier to switch back if this change proves undesirable.

comment.body:
That's one impressive contribution. Merged,
Thank you very much

issue.title: Addition of some popular features
issue.body:
1) Seconds field is now optional and Dow field is mandatory to support standard GNU/Linux crontab format.

2) An optional TZ=<Location> clause (ex : TZ=Europe/London) in the beginning of cron spec to support specification of cron times in that location rather than in the local timezone

Sample usage :
c := cron.New()
c.AddFunc("TZ=Europe/London 07 21 * * *", func() { fmt.Println("Runs at 21:07 London time") }, "London test") 
c.Start()

3) Added a function NextNTimes for Entry struct which returns next (upto) N activation times.

4) Added DST support and test cases from github.com/lukescott/cron feature-dst branch

5) Added safe Remove() and its test cases.

comment.body: All these changes are really great. I'd love to see them merged. Thanks!

issue.title: Use secp256k1_fe_equal_var in secp256k1_fe_sqrt_var.
issue.body:
In theory this should be faster, since secp256k1_fe_equal_var is able to
 shortcut the normalization.  On x86_64 the improvement appears to be in
 the noise for me.  At least it makes the code cleaner.

comment.body:
So, the current implied contract is that field elements have at most magnitude 8, which is verified in all field element operations.

The fe_sqrt routine however accepts a field element a (which, according to the contract can have magnitude up to 8), and is added to t1 (which has magnitude 2), so the addition could result in a field element with magnitude 10, which is not allowed. In practice, all existing code paths are _guaranteed_ (because the veirifcation of magnitudes is static and conservative) to never result in a having magnitude 8.

So the 'bug' could be fixed by just declaring that fe_sqrt takes an argument with magnitude at most 6 (which is already the case in practice).

issue.title: Using the history module breaks slug_candidates
issue.body:
I have a perfectly working model with:
```ruby
class Case < ActiveRecord::Base
  self.primary_key = :case_id
  friendly_id :slug_candidates, use: :slugged

  private

  def slug_candidates
    [
      :name,
      [:name, :full_citation]
    ]
  end
end
```

That has been working perfectly. I'm including the `primary_key` call just in case it's important.

Today I tried to add the `history` module like this:
```ruby
  friendly_id :slug_candidates, use: [:slugged, :history]
```

After that (and running the migration, etc) when I try to add a Case which has the same `name` as another existing one, I get a Postgres error saying the slug is not unique. It's not trying the second option in the `slug_candidates` array. Removing the `history` module makes it work again.

comment.body:
> Is 5.0.4 that buggy?

No. We're bumping the minor version number because there are some small differences in behavior that some applications could in theory be depending on; check the Changelog for specifics to see if it affects you.

> Should I really upgrade to 5.1.0.beta1 even being a beta? 

It's up to you. At the moment the finders module in 5.0 doesn't work on Active Record 4.2, but does in 5.1, but I'm going to backport support to a 5.0.5 release when I release the final version of 5.1.0 (probably this weekend).

issue.title: 検索無しでも見やすい挟み込みリストを作る
issue.body:
## 理由
検索途中まで作ってみたけど、正直いらない。
理由は二つ。
* 普段から譜面みてるから、50~60行から必要情報探すのは苦ではない。
  むしろ検索条件考えるほうがめんどい

* ユーザーが挟み込み先を探す流れを検討し直したため。
  挟み込み先を最終的に確定させるのは楽団員（挟み込みに行く人）であり、
  その人が決断する理由はユーザーと異なる可能性がある。
  そのため、挟み込みリストの段階で絞り込んでしまうと、
  本来挟み込める楽団員が居た演奏会を省いてしまう危険性がある。
  このことから検索機能はユーザーの主目的である「演奏会の集客」に
  不利益を与える危険性があることから、破棄することとした。

## 実現したいこと

* 日付の区切りはハッキリと
* 各列（特に曲目、場所）は上から流し見で把握できること
 * DONE:文章を改行表示できる
 * 横スクロール操作は行わせない
   * 動作が増えて手間
    * ユーザーが楽団情報を読むのは「この楽団に挟み込みに行くor行かないの判断をする」
　ことが目的であり、それを最速で達成するためには、全情報が画面内にあることが必要なため。
* DONE:最寄り駅、場所情報いれなきゃなぁ
 * DONE:会場情報に会場名入れる
 * DONE:最寄り駅に最寄り駅情報入れる
   * DONE:そのためのDB作る
* 日付は外だししよう
* DONEスクレイピングエラーと向き合う
 * 保留：エンコーディングエラー
 * DONE元サイト楽団HPのリンク切れ
   * DONE:2014/1１件目、楽団HPが現在ページを指している

## メモ
* これらが出来たら吹奏楽、合唱、演劇にも波及
  ※仮説※
  市民文化ホールでやるようなイベントは総じて挟み込みしているのかな？
  →調査しよう
* 東京外の演奏会はどうするかな？
  →東京外のひとも使うから排除するのは忍びないけど、
      リンクで外だしするのは全体のスピード感を損なう。
      どうしたものかなぁ。注釈でもいれとこうかなぁ。

issue.title: regexPrintClose failing under Windows unless implicit newline following {{ }}
issue.body:
Commit 11d31911b85a00ccfe042b8aa6465c14fc2f28c7 has caused an issue under Windows (8.1 x86_64) where the following would evaluate fine:

{{hello}}

, but the following would fail:

{{hello}}

with the error: com.mitchellbosecke.pebble.error.ParserException: Unexpected "}" (hello.peb:1) This is because commit 11d31911b85a00ccfe042b8aa6465c14fc2f28c7 changed the newline character in LexerImpl to `String newline = Pattern.quote(System.lineSeparator());`. Having the old `\\n` (before the commit) works fine.

comment.body: Not a problem at all. Glad I could be of help, and nice to see you've fixed it! Cheers :+1:

issue.title: Triangle should look nicer
issue.body:
This is related to #6 but it goes further. I have made a short video (only 8.5 MB) to explain well the problems there are with the triangle right now:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2754299/TriangleAndZoom.mov

Basically, 
1) The triangle is not centred (at least on my configuration, macbook pro, Chrome).
2) The triangle is too short on the horizontal side. The vertical is perfect. So we are using the wrong ratio at least for this machine. Not sure how this changes on other machines
3) the grey rectangle is perfect in its dimensions, but the triangle does not finish where the grey triangle finishes
4) when a person sees the triangle at different zoom levels (zooming in or out of a page, for example if he has a very big monitor, or a very small one, or he cannot see very well) the triangle size does not change in a smooth way.

Note also that there is no effective need to keep a grey background around the triangle, so taking that away might not solve the ratio of the triangle, but at least make it look less ugly.
